reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Promoting economic empowerment and food sovereignty in rural Liberia

description.narrative: The project will 1) finalize the establishment of a peasant cooperative and provide hands-on agro-ecological training to its members, 2) establish and construct six cassawa processing plants for use by 30 Village Saving and Loan Associations (VSLAs), 3) ma ke the village bank operational by equipping it, hiring staff and facilitating its management and 4) documenting the KDA activities to encourage others to struggle out of poverty through a similar process. The project addresses in particular the poverty of women and the elderly in rural Liberia, where there is a shortage of farmland and formal financing to develop agricultural activities. As a result of the project, 30 VSLAs are expected to become a multi-purpose cooperative, increasingly apply agro-ecologi cal farming practices and increase the production of nutritious food both for their own consumption and for local markets. In addition, members of the cooperative are expected to use the community bank to develop cassawa cultivation and thereby increase th eir income and improve their economic and social position in the community. The direct beneficiaries of the project are the 1 200 KDA members who are members of the 30 VSLAs affiliated to the cooperative to be established, are involved in the functioning of the six cassawa mills and are trained in agro-ecological farming. The 30 VSLAs are institutional members of the KDA. 2/3 of the members are women. Indirect beneficiaries include other KDA members who are not directly involved in the project activities but may become community bank clients. Other stakeholders include local farmers and intermediaries who bring cassawa for processing to the mills, buy it or resell it. The project is implemented by the Ka Paa Kwa Geh Development Association based in Bong County, Liberia (KDA, www.kdaliberia.org).
